title: Michel Sitjar
text:
Michel Sitjar (13 September 1942 – 10 June 2019) was an international <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player for <a href="France%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">France</a> and played club rugby for <a href="SU%20Agen%20Lot-et-Garonne">Agen</a>. He also tried <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> for a year in <a href="XIII%20Catalan">XIII Catalan</a> after brutally stopping his career at 28. Sitjar played as a <a href="Rugby_union_positions%23Flanker">flanker</a> and won three <a href="Bouclier%20de%20Brennus">Brennus Shields</a> with the <a href="Sporting%20Union%20Agenais">Sporting Union Agenais</a> (1962, 1965 and 1966). 
In 2008 he published his first collection of poems ("Rugby & Poésie"), followed by the second one "Rugby & Poésie, deuxième mi-temps" two years later. 
He killed himself at his home in <a href="Lamagist%C3%A8re">Lamagistère</a> on June 10, 2019.
